item.title: No title
item.description: I'm confident humans don't get the real meaning of infinity. they think it is something that has no limits, so it is said to be infinite. how far from the truth: something is infinite when it transmutates back into itself. so it is infinite because it has no ends. even imagination has it is limit. consciousness is the closest thing to infinity.

item.title: the story of my design lab @Telenor
Connecting
item.description:
Connecting

What is interaction design? As technology advances, the way we communicate evolves. But it's important not to lose ourselves and focus on enabling natural interactions.

item.title: Enantiodromia
item.description:
Enantiodromia

Enantiodromia ( Greek: ἐνάντιος, enantios, opposite + δρόμος, dromos, running course) is a principle introduced by psychiatrist Carl Jung that the superabundance of any force inevitably produces its opposite. It is similar to the principle of equilibrium in the natural world, in that any extreme is opposed by the system in order to restore balance.

item.title: Making Material Design
item.description:
Making Material Design

A behind-the-scenes look at building Google's visual framework. Find out more about material design at www.google.com/design.
